text:
It seems to me, that the markdown tables when used with Documenter.jl, cannot have to many columns (or too much information in there) before it already spawns the whole screens  and starts to  add newlines. Is there a way to specify some formatting rules or mabye another package that can be used in combination with Documenter.jl?
Or is the only solution to write hmtl myself?

And on a related note, I did not have any luck using latex expressions in table cells - it it correct that latex does not work there?

elements.text:
It seems to me, that the markdown tables when used with Documenter.jl, cannot have to many columns (or too much information in there) before it already spawns the whole screens  and starts to  add newlines. Is there a way to specify some formatting rules or mabye another package that can be used in combination with Documenter.jl?
Or is the only solution to write hmtl myself?

And on a related note, I did not have any luck using latex expressions in table cells - it it correct that latex does not work there?

text: latex should work, although it might be restricted to inline equations only (i.e. no ```math blocks)

elements.text: latex should work, although it might be restricted to inline equations only (i.e. no ```math blocks)

text: ah good idea, I did totally not think of that. Inline latex is more than sufficient, I just need to specify some time complexities

elements.text: ah good idea, I did totally not think of that. Inline latex is more than sufficient, I just need to specify some time complexities

text: re the formatting: nope, there's no built-in way to customize the style of the tables like that.. you'd have to hack something together with custom css, at-raw blocks or something along those lines
